intro: Saccoloma inaequale var. dimorphum, commonly known as the variable saccoloma, is a rare fern species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows on shaded, moist rock surfaces or tree trunks in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, with a distinctive, intricate structure. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
